oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Comparison of Clinical Efficacy of Ceftiofur to Oxytetracycline for Treatment of Acute Puerperal Metritis in Cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schmitt, Eric J.
Boucher, Joseph F.
Van den Eede, Chris A,.
Chenault, John R.
Van Oye, Sophie N.
Maes, Veerle J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ceftiofur hydrochloride
subcutaneously
intramuscularly
metritis
antibiotic
oxytetracycline hydrochloride
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The objective of this randomized study was to evaluate the efficacy of ceftiofur hydrochloride (ExcenelÂ® RTU) administered subcutaneously at the daily dose of 1.0 mg ceftiofur equivalents (CE)/kg body weight (BW) (0.45 mg/lb) for five days for the treatment of acute puerperal metritis in cows in Europe. This treatment was compared to a control of oxytetracycline hydrochloride administered intramuscularly at the daily dose of 10 mg/kg body weight (4.5 mg/lb) for five days, an antibiotic registered for treatment of metritis in Europe.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2001; 199
